title: Memorial for Tim Helmers
description: A tribute to the life and memory of Tim Helmers
name: Timothy Patrick Helmers
bio: Tim Helmers was born in Plano, Illinois on October 11, 1987, to Patrick and Denise Helmers. He was a person who lived life with a deep sense of service and adventure. As a proud Boy Scout, Tim embodied the values of Scouting America throughout his life. From 2002 to 2008, he spent his summers as a camp counselor at Camp Robert Drake in Fairmount, Illinois, where he met his lifelong friends, David and Joshua Stack. Tim's commitment to service continued with his enlistment in the Coast Guard, serving as a Gunner's Mate from 2007 until 2010. In 2014, he graduated from Trinidad State College as a certified gunsmith, and in 2019, he earned a bachelor's degree in parks and recreation from Aurora University. At the time of his passing, Tim was a facilities maintainer with the Parkrose School District in Portland, Oregon. He was known for his contributions, home-baked cookies, and his role in the school district's wellness committee. Tim's love for the outdoors and scouting activities like cooking, gunsmithing, archery, and camping was unparalleled. He was also a creative and thoughtful gift-giver. Tim spent pivotal years with his uncle, Craig Joseph Dienberg, in Washington, cherishing the wisdom and kindness Craig imparted on him. Tim adored being an uncle to James, Zoe, and Kai Helmers, finding genuine joy in their company. He is survived by his parents, Pat and Denise Helmers, and his brothers, Michael, John, and Christopher. Tim is fondly remembered by his many cousins, aunts, uncles, and dear friend Ashley Porter. A Festival of Remembrance will be held at 2 p.m., Saturday, July 6th, at the Helmers Homestead in Plano, IL.

tributes.message: I first met Tim at John and Colleen's wedding. My first impression of him was his quietness and the maturity of a big brother, yet he was always there for his family and having fun with them. He was also present at our wedding, and I wish I could talk to him more. Tim, you will be missed deeply, and I hope you rest in peace.
